name: heat production, hardwood chips from forest, at furnace 300kW, state-of-the-art 2014 | heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11487/documentation

This activity represents the combustion of natural wood chips from forest in Switzerland in new (=installed in 2014) boilers and is used as GLO activity as first approximation with adjusted uncertainties. Equipped with an industrila electrostatic precipitator in order to comply with PM emission regulation.  Characteristics of the of wood chips to be burned: Dry wood density 650kg/m3; Energy content (LHV, oven-dry) 18.3 MJ/kg. The humidity of the wood chips when burned is assumed to be in an accurate range for appropriate combustion conditions, which is achieved after some weeks of natural drying in the storage. Air emission factors as well as the boiler efficiency represent average annual operation including start and stop (warm-up and shut-down). Therefore, emission data will be higher and efficiency will be lower than rated values provided by manufacturers. The inventory shall be considered as being representative also for boilers with nominal capacities in the approximate range of 70 kW to 500 kW. 

from delivery of wood chips

This activity describes the combustion of natural wood chips from forest in new (=installed in 2014) boilers. Included are the infrastructure, the wood requirements (wood chips from forest), the emissions to air, the electricity needed for operation, and the disposal of the ashes.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/353:Steam and air conditioning supply/3530:Steam and air conditioning supply

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Key emission factors PM, CO, NMVOC, CH4, NOx as well as the average annual efficiency have been updated using the latest available information. Other emission data (which hardly depend on the combustion technology) are from the second half of the 1990´s.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: LCI data for Switzerland were used for the GLO activityy as first approximation with uncertainty factors adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Modern boiler technology available on the Swiss market, installed in 2014.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description:
The numbers used in the mathematical relation refer to the input of one MJ of fuel with the heat output depending on the efficiency of the furnace. Using the "scaling factor" (inverse of the efficiency) allows for scaling of the amount of the reference product to 1.
EcoSpold01Location=CH
